sentence.Network_en: Don't think this gang is monolithic -- it can be split up.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要以为这帮人是 铁板一块,他们是可以分化的.

sentence.Network_en: Mathematics is not a single monolithic structure of absolute truth!
sentence.Network_cn: 数学并不是绝对真理的单一整体结构。

sentence.Network_en: When Stalin established a more monolithic rule the term disappeared in Russia.
sentence.Network_cn: 当斯大林建立一种更铁板一块的统治时,这一术语在俄国便消失了.

entry.tran: (组织或体系)庞大而僵化的，单一的
entry.def: If you refer to an organization or system as monolithic, you are critical of it because it is very large and very slow to change, and does not seem to have different parts with different characters.

entry.tran: 庞大而无特点的;巨大而单调的
entry.def: If you describe something such as a building as monolithic, you do not like it because it is very large and plain with no character.

example.tran: 毫无特色的庞大混凝土建筑

means.word_mean: 1. imposing in size or bulk or solidity;
2. characterized by massiveness and rigidity and total uniformity;

auth_sentence.content: We didn't have a large, monolithic spill.
auth_sentence.res_content: We didn't have a large, monolithic spill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We didn't have a large, monolithic spill.

auth_sentence.content: He called his invention an act of monolithic insanity.

auth_sentence.content: One, monolithic, impartial view was unnecessary.
